description: Daria Tomenko, torn between reinforcing Council authority and pursuing truth, decides to expose Halden’s fate. Using an encrypted admin token, she covertly accesses and packages key audit logs and medical reports tied to Halden’s death and the Council's coverup.
Sensitive documents—Halden's toxicology report, sealed medical records, and evidence of manipulated BCI audits—are discreetly distributed via trusted reformist networks across the free zones.
The leak ignites citywide outrage as trusted free zone organizers verify the authenticity of the documents. Vigils and street gatherings proliferate, with citizens demanding Council accountability.
The Council enters emergency session. Directorate urges severe crackdowns, Harmonists seek to suppress fallout, while Innovators argue for partial transparency to calm unrest.

Under mounting civic pressure, the Council concedes to limited transparency—releasing some audit records and issuing a formal apology without admitting culpability. Distrust simmers as free zone debates intensify over accountability versus reconciliation.
